title: Led Zeppelin - For Badgeholders Only (6/27/1977)
description:
Quoted from Wikipedia:

For Badgeholders Only/SGT Pages Badgeholders Club is a bootleg recording of a rock concert by English band Led Zeppelin, performed on June 23, 1977 at the Los Angeles Forum in Los Angeles, California, a show which came towards the end of the band's 1977 North American concert tour.

Like the better-known Listen to This Eddie this concert was recorded by a member of the audience, Mike Millard, and was later released illegally on vinyl and CD without the permission of the band.

The title For Badgeholders Only most likely comes from Robert Plant's numerous references to "Badgeholders" throughout the concert. For example, before performing "Trampled Under Foot", Plant asks "Is there anybody on the spotlights who could find us a badgeholder?"

The release is notable not only for the band's strong performance and superb sound quality recording, but also for the surprise guest, Keith Moon from The Who. Moon plays throughout the nearly 20 minute drum solo and returns later for the encores.



The setlist is:

   1. "Intro" - (1:47)
   2. "The Song Remains the Same" (Page, Plant) - (5:26)
   3. "The Rover (intro)
   4. "Sick Again"(Page, Plant) - (6:56)
   5. "Nobody's Fault but Mine" (Page, Plant) - (7:14)
   6. "Over the Hills and Far Away" (Page, Plant) - (7:20)
   7. "No Quarter" (Page, Plant, Jones) - (31:00)
   8. "Since I've Been Loving You" (Page, Plant, Jones) - (8:50)
   9. "Ten Years Gone" (Page, Plant) - (10:35)
  10. "The Battle of Evermore" (Page, Plant) - (7:21)
  11. "Going to California" (Page, Plant) - (6:40)
  12. "Black Country Woman" (Page, Plant) - (3:04)
  13. "Bron-Yr-Aur (Stomp)" (Page, Plant, Jones) - (5:40)
  14. "White Summer"/"Black Mountain Side" (Page - (9:33)
  15. "Kashmir" (Page, Plant, Jones) - (9:46)
  16. "Trampled Underfoot" - (Page, Plant, Jones)
  17. "Out on the Tiles" / "Over The Top"/"Moby Dick" (with Keith Moon) - (Page, Plant, Bonham)
  18. "Jimmy Page Guitar Solo" (Page)
  19. "Achilles Last Stand" (Page, Plant)
  20. "Stairway to Heaven" (Page, Plant)
  21. "Whole Lotta Love" / "Rock and Roll" (encore) (with Keith Moon)



All tracks are 256 kB/s.  Unfortunately, I do not have this in FLAC, so if you happen to have it, upload it for the rest of us.


EDIT:  It has been brought to my attention that the tracks are not in the proper order.  Use the guide mqrkeredd has posted for the correct one.  I would reupload my files, but I don't want to lose the seeders from this one.  Sorry about that.


Thanks!
